uh and email is no different to that um and so when you are sending emails
there's actually there's three uh things that um you absolutely need to send for amp html emails uh so
there's spf dkim and dmarc uh so your email sender must pass all three of these in order to send an
mphtml an amp email so spf is a dns record that specifies the ip addresses that can send
mail on behalf of a domain um so this allows a mailbox to say hey i
got this email and it came from this ip address i'm going to check this dns
entry and uh and see if it was allowed to send it to me if it wasn't it's going to be much as as spam or it's going to be more
suspicious dkim is a way to sign the content of an email that can be confirmed by the mailbox
so again it's another dns record in this case it has a public key in it that can be used to confirm a signature
on the content of the email so this shows that the email hasn't been altered since leaving the the mailbox and arrive
since leaving the mail sender and arriving in the inbox and then dmarc uh kind of combines um
or builds on top of those two uh to actually provide a way for the domain owners to
understand who's sending email on their behalf so if an email then if an email fails spf or dkim
your dmarc dns record will say what to do with that so
you can say do nothing whatever you can make your own decision but you can also say quarantine so put it into spam or just
block it so if you are convinced that somebody else is sending this email on your behalf you can tell a mailbox that's
looking up a dmarc record just not to not ever put this in an inbox uh it's
not from you you can also get reports uh so you can set up email addresses within that dmarc
record to tell a mailbox what to do to tell mailbox to send reports about these emails back to you so you
can understand what's going on um so you actually want these if you're
sending lots of email you want these three things anyway so that is probably um so hopefully it's
